intro: Campanula betonicifolia var. byzantina, commonly known as the Byzantine bellflower, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It features upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
